body: It seems the rules still check `parserOptions.ecmaVersion` though the flat config pulls this up a level (`languageOptions`).  Setting `languageOptions.parserOptions.ecmaVersion` (even as `'latest'`) mitigates this issue.
Possibly related to https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/15366 but that issue seems directed differently.

Does this problem only happen with `languageOptions.ecmaVersion = 'latest'`? Can you check with `languageOptions.ecmaVersion = 2023`, would it work as expected or the same as with `languageOptions.ecmaVersion = 'latest'`?

Okay, so `'latest'` itself is not the problem. The problem is that `comma-dangle` and a few other core rules are using `context.parserOptions.ecmaVersion`, which isn't set in the flat config mode.

Possible solutions are:

1. Update rules to use `context.languageOptions.ecmaVersion` instead.
2. Update `Linter` to set `context.parserOptions.ecmaVersion` (based on `context.languageOptions.ecmaVersion`).

I think we should do `1.` even if we later decide to implement `2.` for backward compatibility, so updating rules seems like the right fix for this problem.

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

Updates core rules that were using `context.parserOptions.ecmaVersion` to use `context.languageOptions.ecmaVersion` instead.

The rules are:

* comma-dangle
* func-name-matching
* no-misleading-character-class
* prefer-regex-literals

This ensures that the rules work as intended in flat config mode.

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

Marked as `feat` because this change might produce more warnings. In particular, non-number `parserOptions.ecmaVersion` in eslintrc configs will be treated as the latest ecma version.
